segments.text: I see the boy standing on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks so determined, completely focused on his task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks wobbly, and I can't help but feel worried for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is right there, waiting for her share, her hand outstretched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the excitement in their eyes, the thrill of getting away with something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They don't even notice the water overflowing from the sink, just like their mother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what they'll do if they get caught, how they'll react.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mother is just standing there, drying dishes, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of anticipation, wondering what will happen next.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will they get away with it, or will the stool tip, causing a commotion?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit envious of their carefree attitude.
segments.speaker: PAR
